summary: canine distemper virus (CDV) is a highly contagious and fatal systemic disease in free-living carnivores worldwide. RT-RPA assay could detect CDV, but did not show cross-detection of canine parvovirus-2, canine coronavirus (CCoV), canine parainfluenza virus (CPIV), pseudorabies virus (PRV) or Newcastle disease virus (NDV) point-of-care facility, especially in resource-limited settings.
